title: Insurance agency logo I need to recreate.
author: cplea

comments.content: They all look like [Calibri](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065057/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/calibri) to me part for 'Cameron Agencies' which has probably been artificially thinned.

Thanks. I was thinking its shapes were very much like Calibri, but there's no thin version of Calibri and the ends seem more straight and less rounded than Calibri's. But you certainly could be right. It may be thinned after the fact. Great...now I gotta start the thinning...
I guess simply adding an outline stroke should do the job.

Yeah that's what I ended up doing. Played with a couple different stroke widths until it looked about right and trimmed them off. Looks identical now. Thanks for pointing out Calibri as I was completely in the mindset that it must be an actual font and not a modified Calibri until you mentioned it.

To conclude, find a reputed insurance company. There are many insurance companies that offer home insurance. You can find them online. A big [home insurance company](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065057/http:/www.thepropertyinsurer.co.uk/) will allow you to shop their policies online. So, get your home insured and live a risk-free and care-free life.
